ho-guom.name: Hoan Kiem Lake
ho-guom.title: Hoan Kiem Lake
ho-guom.subtitle: The Heart of the Capital
ho-guom.history: Hoan Kiem Lake is associated with the legend of King Le Loi returning the magic sword to the Golden Turtle after defeating the Ming invaders. It is a sacred symbol of the nation's peace-loving spirit.
ho-guom.culture: The ensemble of Ngoc Son Temple, The Huc Bridge, and Turtle Tower creates a unique spiritual cultural space, where the spiritual essence of Thang Long's thousand-year civilization converges.
ho-guom.quote:
Let's go see the Kiem Ho scenery,
See The Huc bridge, see Ngoc Sơn temple.
ho-guom.narrative: The lake mirrors ancient tower shadows, where the legend of the divine sword blends with millennia of mist...

quiz.question: Where is the Turtle Tower located in Hoan Kiem Lake?
quiz.fact: The Turtle Tower was built on a small mound in the middle of the lake, serving as an iconic image associated with the poetic and ancient beauty of Hanoi.

o-quan-chuong.name: O Quan Chuong
o-quan-chuong.title: O Quan Chuong
o-quan-chuong.subtitle: Thousand-year Heritage
o-quan-chuong.history: In the 15th century, O Quan Chuong street area belonged to Thanh Ha village, Dong Ha ward, a ward east of Thang Long citadel. Dong Ha was a ward bordering the Red River, sheltered by a dike preventing floods. Dong Ha Mon was built during the period of rebuilding the old dike into an earthen citadel surrounding Thang Long citadel; and was one of the five city gates built in the 10th year of Canh Hung (1749), including: Phuc Lam gate, Nhan Hoa gate, Cau Den gate, Cau Dua gate and Dong Ha gate. By the 46th year of Canh Hung (1785), O Quan Chuong was extensively renovated. The architectural structure today is the result of the construction in the 3rd year of Gia Long (1804).
o-quan-chuong.culture: Dong Ha Mon is a gate architecture built in the style of a watchtower, consisting of two stories. Dong Ha Mon was an important gate of the outer ring of Thang Long citadel during the 36 streets period, and also a gate opening to the Red River pier, undoubtedly holding an important position in trade exchange.
o-quan-chuong.quote: It can be said that Dong Ha Mon is the most accurate name of the city gate relic, but the people still commonly call it O Quan Chuong.
o-quan-chuong.narrative: Shadows of the ancient city gate bear the marks of time, where street vendors have come and gone since dawn and dusk...

quiz.question: O Quan Chuong is one of how many city gates built in 1749?
quiz.fact: O Quan Chuong is one of 5 city gates built in 1749 during the reign of King Le Hien Tong. It is the only remaining gate of the old Thang Long citadel.

hang-buom.name: Hang Buom
hang-buom.title: Hang Buom Street
hang-buom.subtitle: Trading Port Imprint
hang-buom.history: Formerly a gathering place for sail makers and water-related trade items. The street sits near the old Red River pier, making it a bustling gateway for commerce.
hang-buom.culture: This area still preserves the Cantonese Assembly Hall and Bach Ma Temple - one of the four sacred guards of Thang Long protecting the citadel.
hang-buom.quote:
Hanoi has thirty-six streets,
Hang Buom, Hang Bac, Hang Ngang, Hang Dao.
hang-buom.narrative: A small street fragrant with incense, echoing temple bells amidst the bustling quarter...

quiz.question: Which famous destination is located on Hang Buom Street?
quiz.fact: Bach Ma Temple, located at 76 Hang Buom, is the oldest temple among the four guards of Thang Long citadel.

hang-dong.name: Hang Dong
hang-dong.title: Hang Dong Street
hang-dong.subtitle: Copper Resonance
hang-dong.history: The street is a gathering place for famous copper smiths from Ngu Xa village and surrounding areas, specializing in ritual items, copper trays, and pots.
hang-dong.culture: The sounds of chiseling and hammering day and night have created a unique rhythm for this traditional handicraft street of Hanoi.
hang-dong.quote:
Ngu Xa village for copper casting,
Hang Dong for selling in the morning light.
hang-dong.narrative: The steady rhythm of hammers echoes through the alley, where forge fires illuminate cold winter nights...

quiz.question: What is the most famous handicraft product of Hang Dong Street?
quiz.fact: Hang Dong Street has long been famous for copper products such as ritual items, trays, pots... crafted by Ngu Xa village artisans.

hang-trong.name: Hang Trong
hang-trong.title: Hang Trong Street
hang-trong.subtitle: Soulful Strokes
hang-trong.history: Famous for drum making and especially the Hang Trong folk painting style that was once renowned, serving spiritual and decoration needs for Tet.
hang-trong.culture: Hang Trong paintings carry an elegant, refined beauty, expressing the depth of soul and high aesthetic sense of ancient Hanoi people.
hang-trong.quote:
Hang Trong paintings for the spring,
Hang Ngang couplets bright in the hall.
hang-trong.narrative: Each masterful brushstroke imprints the soul of a nation, where folk colors blend with sacred drum beats...

quiz.question: Which folk painting style is associated with Hang Trong Street?
quiz.fact: Hang Trong painting is one of Vietnam's typical folk painting styles, destacated for its sophisticated coloring techniques.

lan-ong.name: Lan Ong
lan-ong.title: Lan Ong Street
lan-ong.subtitle: Herbal Scent
lan-ong.history: The street is named after Hai Thuong Lan Ong - a brilliant physician. Since old times, this has been the hub for traditional oriental medicine shops.
lan-ong.culture: The intense aroma of oriental herbs spreading throughout the street is an unmistakable characteristic, showing the preservation of national medical essence.
lan-ong.quote:
Lan Ong street with aromatic medicine,
Pulse diagnosis and prescriptions for a peaceful life.
lan-ong.narrative: Herbal fragrances drift gently through the air, where ancestral remedies preserve the essence of ancient healing...

quiz.question: Which traditional profession is Lan Ong Street famous for?
quiz.fact: Lan Ong Street is the largest oriental medicine trading center in Hanoi, preserving the profession of medicine for generations.

dong-xuan.name: Dong Xuan
dong-xuan.title: Dong Xuan Market
dong-xuan.subtitle: Bustling Marketplace
dong-xuan.history: Built by the French administration in 1889, this is the largest market in Hanoi, witnessing the heroic fight to protect the capital in winter 1946.
dong-xuan.culture: The market is not just a place for trade but also a cultural icon of Hanoi life with its characteristic 5-vaulted door structure.
dong-xuan.quote:
The most joyful is Dong Xuan market,
Everything is there, for people near and far.
dong-xuan.narrative: Five-arched roofs stand tall amidst the streets, witnessing countless festive Tet market seasons...

quiz.question: In what year was Dong Xuan Market built?
quiz.fact: Dong Xuan Market was built in 1889 on the site of the old To Lich river pier, becoming a trade symbol of Thang Long.

hang-ma.name: Hang Ma
hang-ma.title: Hang Ma Street
hang-ma.subtitle: Vibrant Colors
hang-ma.history: The street specializes in votive paper items for rituals and folk toys for children during Mid-Autumn and Tet festivals.
hang-ma.culture: This is always the most colorful and bustling street in the old quarter during festival seasons, preserving the childhood memories of many generations.
hang-ma.quote:
Mid-autumn lantern procession on Hang Ma,
Bright star lanterns, joyful streets.
hang-ma.narrative: Streets ablaze with colorful paper decorations, where generations of childhoods merge in festival laughter...

quiz.question: When is Hang Ma Street most bustling?
quiz.fact: Hang Ma Street is the center of traditional festivals, providing decorations and folk toys in Hanoi.

hang-ngang.name: Hang Ngang
hang-ngang.title: Hang Ngang Street
hang-ngang.subtitle: Historical Milestone
hang-ngang.history: Hang Ngang Street was once the wealthiest in the old quarter, famous for silk shops. House No. 48 is where Uncle Ho wrote the Declaration of Independence.
hang-ngang.culture: The intersection of architecture and commercial prosperity has turned Hang Ngang into a symbol of the capital's elegance and aristocracy.
hang-ngang.quote:
No. 48 Hang Ngang, a new history page,
Shining independence, radiant country.
hang-ngang.narrative: A small house on an ancient street, where each written word forged a new chapter in the nation's history...

quiz.question: Which major historical event is associated with Hang Ngang Street?
quiz.fact: House No. 48 Hang Ngang is where President Ho Chi Minh wrote the Declaration of Independence, founding the Democratic Republic of Vietnam.

hang-bac.name: Hang Bac
hang-bac.title: Hang Bac Street
hang-bac.subtitle: Silver Craft Essence
hang-bac.history: Hang Bac Street was formed in the 15th century, gathering talented jewelers from three famous craft villages: Chau Khe, Dong Xam, and Dinh Cong. It was once the place where silver bullion was cast for the court.
hang-bac.culture: The street still retains its ancient architecture and traditional jewelry shops, where manual silver carving techniques are preserved through many generations.
hang-bac.quote:
Hang Bac craftsmen skillfully carve flowers,
Bright silver bullion, elegant silk.
hang-bac.narrative: Silver gleams beneath artisan hands, where every thread of silver tells a century-old story...

quiz.question: Which traditional profession is Hang Bac Street famous for?
quiz.fact: Hang Bac Street is the most bustling jewelry center in the old quarter, famous for sophisticated silver engraving and filigree techniques.
